english.segment1: October wind, chills his skin. He walks home alone. A tiny house, a loving wife. hands worked to the bone
english.segment2: But he don't mind his humble life. In this rundown town. To be a sun. A ray of one. Like he's always done
english.segment3: And it's alright. To be there where he's always been. He'll live to light. This dark town he's in
english.segment4: The clock strikes old, on his achy bones. His final setting sun. And so he rests on an unfamiliar bed. And smiles to the Lord, his love
english.segment5: And it's alright. To be there where he's always been. He lived to light. This dark town of sin
english.segment6: And so he leaves, and he breathes. A soul so full of his crown. A life that was spent in being content. In the midst of a rundown town.
